content: Investments Stocks Asked by AnonymousAsked on 24 May 2019Is it foolish to buy 100 units of stock with $10 of processing fee?Feel like trying my hand at buying 100 units of a stock (about $0.80 per share), is it foolish to do so? Or should I accumulate more capital before buying?1 answerAnswerBump1
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Tracy LimLevel 5. GeniusUpdated on 07 Jun 2019You can take a look at the percentage of the transaction fees to the total price you are paying.In this case you're paying $0.80/share x 100 = $80Transaction fee = $10Effectively, you're paying $80+$10 for 100 shares. i.e:Cost per share = $0.90It means you will need to see the share increase $0.10 before you break even. That means 12.5% increase. After which, you will see a gain. But anything less you are losing.So to answer your question, if you think the stock can increase 12.5% (or $0.10 per share in this case) when you exit, then nope it's not foolish!1 comment3
